Description: Bronze plastic lamp in the form of a seated horse, the forelegs broken away; the two nozzles which extended from below the forelegs are also broken away. The square filling-hole is pierced through the back of the horse, with a hinge-piece above the rump for a lid (now lost). At the rear is a double rod-handle, springing from the hind legs, joining on the upward curve and separating at the upper spring; above is a horizontal palmette supported by an S-shaped bracket. The lamp stands on an oval base-ring.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3597)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
